iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Building media competence in Palestine

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Community Development Programme in Gaza and West Bank. The purpose of the Community Development Programme is to empower a local partner for high quality and sustainable development work in Gaza and Jericho. Fidaâs partner in the programme is the Palestinian Bible Society (PBS)_ which is a non-profit organization registered with both the Palestinian and Israeli governments. Through the programme_ the PBS staff receives training in the Community Health Education and is equipped with tools and know-how for holistic development work. Special emphasis is given to women_ children and PWDs. The programme includes also child sponsorship. As the programme progresses_ the partnerâs capacities increase and the organization will be able to carry out successful development work on its own. These developments together will improve the quality of life and social harmony in the area.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Environmental Protection Project in Bethlehem. Founding of nature reserve that serves also as an educational tool for the students.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Education Promotion Project in Bethlehem. Renovating school labs in order to promote the level of education.

iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Ramallah

iati-activity.title: Water and Sanitation Project III
iati-activity.description: The planned project consists of rehabilitation_ expanding and installation of water networks and main water pipelines. It also includes the establishment and training of two water management units_ one for each JWSC. These units will be responsible on managing_ operating and maintaining the water system within its statutory area. The management shall be based on sustainability and full cost recovery approach including the investment costs.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Community Based Development Programme for Palestinian Population
iati-activity.description: Members of 75 communities have access to health and social issues knowledge and use services provided by PRCS (Palestine Red Crescent Society) and the community.

iati-activity.title: Support to Pegase
iati-activity.description: Pegase is an aid mechanism administered by the EU comission. Pegase has four axes_ which are governance_ social development_ economic and private sector development_ and public infrastructure development.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Rehabilitation and prevention of War Trauma
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to create a family centered approach in rehabilitation and prevention of war trauma. The PMRS will introduce psychosocial help for traumatized clients as an integrated part of all established PMRS activities. Together with the Finnish partner it provides training and education_ councelling and support through all PMRS activities: the women_s health program_ community health centers_ community based rehabilitation program_ youth centers_ first aid group and the mobile clinic teams. The special emphasis is on children_ teenagers_ women and families. In addtion the project aims to increase the awareness about the psychosocial health issues.

iati-activity.title: Support to Palestinian Civil Police
iati-activity.description: A professionally trained and self sufficient Palestinian Civil Police (PCP) is corner stone of law and order leading to a secure and independent Palestinian state. The objective is to support programmes aimed toward stabilizing law and order_ thereby improving the lives of the Palestinian people.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Frikyrklig samverkan FS rf)
iati-activity.description: Culture center. The main purpose of the project is to transform the existing orphanage towards smaller units of about 8 children + a mother

iati-activity.description: International Center of Bethlehem. Support to the International Center of Bethlehem.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Palestinian Adm. Areas
iati-activity.description: The Elderly Supportive Community Center. ESCC supports elderly people in East Jerusalem with Israeli bureaucracy and other day-to-day tasks. The Human Resource Development Foundation is working in the area of population and development with special emphasis on training_ service provision and advocacy activities for vulnerable groups. The project aims at combatting human trafficking process in Turkey by raising the awareness of irregular migrant women who could be potential victims of human trafficking.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Palestinian Adm. Areas
iati-activity.description: Environmental education in the Jordan River Valley. Advancing environmental education in the Palestinian southern _core area_ of the Jordan River Valley in Auja.

iati-activity.description: To support the Education Ministry's 5 year education development strategic plan through a sector wide approach.

iati-activity.title: UNESCO media project
iati-activity.description: Promotion of the freedom of expression, safety of journalists and empowering women in media to enhance respect for human rights in the Gaza Strip and West Bank.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: UNRWA Summer Games
iati-activity.description: Summer Games 2009 will build on the success of the Summer Games programme - achieved despite the myriad challenges - over the past two years and offer up to 250,000 children in Gaza a series of educational and recreational activities across 8 weeks. In doing so, and in accordance with UNRWAâs wider human development aims, Summer Games hopes to provide a counterbalance to the backdrop of violence, poverty and lack of educational opportunities that drives radicalization. This will be achieved through continued partnership with key civil society members in Gaza.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to food security and income through Finnish Church Aid
iati-activity.description: Food security and income generation in oPT.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Fostering Palestinian Dialogue on a National Agenda
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of this action is to contribute to Palestinian unity - a precondition to the continuation of the Middle East Process. This is to be achieved through a bottom-up support process for dialogue on Palestinian national reconciliation in which medium level political actors identify, agree upon and advocate elements to a draft Palestinian national agenda.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Organizational Assessment of UNRWA's Education Programme
iati-activity.description: UNRWA has decided to assess its support to the education sector services to the Palestinian refugees in Libanon, Syria and the Palestinian terrotories. Finland will recruit an expert to give consultancy services to the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland and UNRWA during the UNRWA education sector assessment process. Finland supports the said assessment separately with 100 000 euros.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Palestinian Adm. Areas
iati-activity.description: Strengthening women's leadership'. 'Strenghtening Women's leadership' programme consists of two joint conferences for 30 female participants from the Palestinian territories, Kingdom of Jordan ja Israel (both Jews and Arabs). The goals of the programme are: Strengthening women's leadeship skills, role and opportunities in society and business. To advance the overall objective of prosperity, stability and peace in the Middle East through a grassroot level regional dialogue.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Palestinian Adm. Areas
iati-activity.description: Freedom of Movement'. Providing administrative and legal intervention on behalf of individuals seeking permits to travel inside and outside the Palestinian territories. The following constitute core themes to be addressed throughout the implementation of the project: 1) Movement abroad 2) West Bank - Gaza Strip separation policy 3) Forced transfer and displacement 4) Divided families 5) The separation wall.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Palestinian Adm. Areas
iati-activity.description: Territorial link between WB and Gaza & solution for palestinian refugees. The Aix Group, now in its fourth phase of research, conducts economic analysis of key issues to be included in any future final status agreement between Israel and the Palestinian Authority. The aims of the 4th phase research project are: 1) To broadly examine the economic implications of the territorial link, including impact and significance, construction methods, and future potential for development; to provide decision-makers with much needed research and analysis to help them formulate better policies regarding the territorial link 2) To elaborate further on the issue of Palestinian refugees, tackling new questions that have not yet been examined but have been raised by the negotiating teams on both sides as well as by other local and international key players.

iati-activity.title: Education sector support consultancy
iati-activity.description: Finland supports the Palestinian Authority's Education Development Strategic Plan through sector progamme with 9 million euros between 2010-2013. To quarantee adequate monitoring of the sector programme and active participation in sector dialogue, the MFA will hire a consultant to support the work of the MFA.
